0: Article Excerpt NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR LONDON—Barclays PLC wants to move on from Robert Diamond. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In its latest effort to break with the legacy of its former chief executive, the British bank Tuesday presented a three-year strategy that will see the scandal-plagued lender cut 3,700 jobs and rein in some of Mr. Diamond's boldest expansion plans. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "Barclays is changing…there will be no going back to the old way of doing things," current Chief Executive Antony Jenkins said while standing on a white stage in a hall several miles from the group's London headquarters.
